node.title: Bee swarm interrupts Wellington v Canterbury Plunket Shield clash
node.description: Players and umpires were forced to take action as a swarm made its way to the middle.
node.content: ["Players were forced into evasive action on the opening day of Wellington's Plunket Shield clash against Canterbury, as a swarm of bees interrupted proceedings.", "In the 22nd over of the opening day's play, the two Canterbury batters, Wellington fielders and the two on-field umpires were forced to take action when the swarm made its way towards the wicket.", "After a short delay, play resumed as the day's play yielded 18 wickets.", "With Canterbury's opening pair of Chad Bowes at the crease during the bee swarm invasion, the visitors collapsed after play resumed, slipping from 86/0 to 156 all out.", "Bowes top-scored with 59, but was the only Canterbury batter to pass 40, despite contributions from Ken McClure (34), Leo Carter (22) and Cam Fletcher (23).", "Michael Snedded finished as the pick of Wellington's bowlers with 3/28, while newly capped Blackcap Ben Sears took 3/40.", "In response, Wellington's batters also struggled, reaching stumps at 102/8 - trailing by 54 runs with two first innings wickets in hand.", "Jacob Bhula was Wellington's best on show with the bat, albeit scoring just 29, with Henry Shipley (3/7) and Blackcap Matt Henry (3/47) starring with the ball for Canterbury."]
